multiplechoiceresponse.label: What is one of the key differences between the building blocks of artificial neural networks and biological neural networks?
multiplechoiceresponse.description: You can add an optional tip or note related to the prompt like this.

choicegroup.choice: The communication between nodes in artificial neural networks is a continuous time process.
The synaptic release in biological neural networks is a scalar rate.
The interaction between neurons in biological neural networks is a discrete process.
Artificial neural networks have massive parallelization and recurrence, while biological neural networks do not.
